posts.cooked:
Server updates & discussion (old)

@updates-bot will kindly post new signalapp/Signal-Server tags here for us (that only covers the main server at the moment).

These will be posted to the unofficial Discord server as well.

Feel free to talk about the posted changes, but for longer discussions using a separate topic may be better.

(As an example it will post a recent server change soon™.)

Server updates & discussion (old) General Discussion
I have an idea how this can be solved, but for now this post will have to do… could not post commits to Discourse Caused by: unexpected response = Object {"action": String("create_post"), "errors": Array [String("No more than 3 consecutive replies are allowed. Please edit your previous reply, or wait for someone to reply to you.")]}

My owner @awaitlink found out from Limts regarding multiple consecutive posts by same user - #14 by musiko - Meta - Discuss & Discover that, seemingly, more than 3 consecutive posts are allowed if the poster is the topic OP. So here we are.

link_counts.title: Limts regarding multiple consecutive posts by same user - #14 by musiko - Meta - Discuss & Discover

posts.cooked:
New Version: 12.6.0

5 new commits since 12.5.0:

  • Count group auth reqs without pniAsServiceId=true [1]

  • Address potential NullPointerException when calling Collection#contains [2]

  • disable response buffering on the websocket [3]

    Jersey buffers responses (by default up to 8192 bytes) just so it can
    add a content length to responses. We already buffer our responses to
    serialize them as protos, so we can compute the content length
    ourselves. Setting the buffer to zero disables buffering.

  • Migrate DynamicConfigurationManager to use java.util.concurrent [4]

  • Update to the latest version of the spam filter [5]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Server v12.5.0…v12.6.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

0 languages changed since 12.5.0:

No localization changes found

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
updates-bot:
  • De-idiom-ize a “wait for everything to finish” idiom [1]

wait what?

20 chars

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Seems they have to use some function that works with the result of an operation, even though they don’t actually care about the result, in order to wait for the operation to finish.

But in order to do that, they were using a “reduce” function (commonly used in iterator/stream-like contexts to sum/multiply/etc. all values; the closure/lambda function inside operates on each value of the iterator and returns a partial result; in this case it’s possible the “iterator” may ultimately be yielding only one value at most ever).

They’ve figured out that it’s possible to just use an empty “then” function (that would normally have a closure/lambda function inside that would actually do something) without any arguments to achieve the same outcome: doing nothing with the result of the operation.

I guess it makes the code look a bit simpler and less confusing than with that “empty” “reduce”. And there could be some subtle differences in how the code gets executed, although I feel like with something like this both ways would get optimized to the same bytecode/etc. anyway.

links.title: Limts regarding multiple consecutive posts by same user - #14 by musiko - Meta - Discuss & Discover
